result.execSummary:
The defendant Kiel S Gowin was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Barron County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Early release from probation may be considered if all conditions are met.

miscConds.notes:
Per C-31. 
Joint and Several with Co-Defendant Brett A. Morneau. 
Must be paid in full within 30 days.

If probation or extended supervision is allowed to expire or is revoked with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge and provide current financial information.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for any balances due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

Expunction will be granted by the court if all court obligations, supervision fees and restitution are paid in full within the first 6 months of probation and upon defendant's successful completion of probation or sentence.

Must complete any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up recommended by Probation Agent.
Must participate in a restorative justice program/conference that may include the victim(s).
Must testify truthfully against co-defendants.

timeConds.notes: Must meet with the Community Service Coordinator by close of business on Friday, October 24, 2014.

supervisions.notes: Court grants good time and Huber for work, work search, domestic and treatment.
Costs are reduced to civil judgment.

judgments.dispoDesc: Probation is revoked and sentence is imposed.

150 Hours.

Defendant Kiel S Gowin in court with attorney Lauren O. Otto.  Angela Lynn Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
State moves to amend count 2 to two counts:  943.20(1)(a) misdemeanor theft party to a crime and 943.01(1) criminal damage to property party to a crime.
SW - 1 year probation.  Restitution of $271.34 joint and several with co-defendants and to be paid in full during term of probation.
Particpate in Barron County Restorative Justice which may include victim offender conferencing.  Any other evaluations recommended by probation.  150 hours community service.  Court costs.  Upon successful completion of all conditions ordered, expunction will be granted.

Court questions defendant, defendant pleads guilty to two amended misdemeanor charges.  Court accepts and finds guilty.

Argument by State.
Argument by Attorney Otto.
Court relates and orders:

SW - 1 year probation.  Restitution of $271.34 joint and several with co-defendants and to be paid in full within 30 days.
Particpate in Barron County Restorative Justice which may include victim offender conferencing.  Any other evaluations recommended by probation.  150 hours community service and must meet with Community Service Coordinator by close of business on Friday, October 24, 2014.  Court costs.  If necessary, testify truthfully against co-defendants.  Upon successful completion of all conditions ordered within the first six months, expunction will be granted and early release of probation will be considered.
